title: An Antique Barn for a Modern ‘Brady Bunch’
abstract: In Kinderhook, N.Y., a blended family needed more space. Their solution: an 18th-century barn that isn’t nearly as rustic as it looks.

title: Shopping for Sofa Beds
abstract: Sleeper sofas are as useful in cramped apartments as they are in large homes. And the new ones not only look good — they’re comfortable, too.

title: That Apartment You Rented? It’s Not Available. Take This One Instead.
abstract: What can renters do when it turns out that their new home is legally uninhabitable?

title: Homes That Sold for Around $1,500,000
abstract: Recent residential sales in New York City and the region.

title: Brokers With a Song and Dance
abstract: Bohemia Realty caters to (and draws talent from) New York City’s theater community.

title: Luxury Apartments Rise in Industrial Greenpoint
abstract: A 30-story rental tower arrives on Brooklyn’s waterfront.

title: A Renter Decides Not to Go It Alone
abstract: He thought he could navigate the city’s real estate market on his own — until the smell of formaldehyde convinced him he needed an agent.

title: July’s Most Popular Properties
abstract: The TV home of “The Brady Bunch,” on the market for the first time in decades, was the most viewed property of the month.

title: Homes for Sale in Brooklyn, Manhattan and Queens
abstract: This week’s properties are in the Flatiron District, Park Slope South, Brooklyn, and Jackson Heights, Queens.

title: Homes for Sale in New York and Connecticut
abstract: This week’s properties are in Fairfield, Conn., and Lloyd Harbor, N.Y.

title: Wayne, N.J.: Good Schools, Water Views and Retail Vacancies
abstract: The township has reasonably priced housing, a strong school district and several bodies of water. But it is also coping with corporate and retail closures.

title: $400,000 Homes in New York, Michigan and Maine
abstract: A weekend cottage in the Hudson Valley; a 1940s Colonial in Grosse Pointe Farms; and an 1820s house in Nobleboro.

title: House Hunting in … Panama
abstract: Along the Pacific coast, Panama’s beach communities are struggling to attract foreign investment, leading to more affordable homes.

title: Need a Quick Inspection of a 58-Story Tower? Send a Drone
abstract: With their low cost and ease of handling, drones are saving money and time on big construction projects. They could also save lives.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
abstract: Recent commercial real estate transactions in New York.

title: In These Stories, Home Is Where the Heartache Is
abstract: The characters in Lydia Millet’s new linked collection, “Fight No More,” yearn to understand the fractures in their lives.

title: A Rare Break for Renters: 325 Units at Waterside Plaza Could Become Affordable
abstract: A deal between the city and the property’s owner, Richard Ravitch, the former lieutenant governor, would allow longtime residents of the Manhattan complex to age in place.
